item.description:
Advancements in mRNA-Lipid Nanoparticle Technologies: From T-Cell Engineering to Pulmonary Protection
**Episode Summary:** In this episode, we delve into the cutting-edge world of mRNA-lipid nanoparticle formulations and their transformative potential in medical science. Discover how two-dimensional AEX and IP-RPLC techniques shed new light on mRNA integrity and encapsulation efficiency, crucial for developing next-generation vaccines and therapies. We also explore the innovative use of targeted lipid nanoparticles for in vivo T-cell engineering, offering promising strategies for pancreatic tumor treatment. Additionally, learn about the breakthrough lipid-based ionic liquids that enhance mRNA intracellular delivery, and how sphingomyelin-induced lipid rafts improve mRNA uptake in cells. Finally, we discuss the protective role of bee pollen solid lipid nanoparticles against pulmonary toxicity and examine the latest designs in CAR T cell therapies using lipid nanoparticles.
**Show Notes:**
1. **Two-dimensional AEX â€“ IP-RPLC: New insights on mRNA integrity and encapsulation efficiency of mRNA-lipid nanoparticle formulations** (Analytica Chimica Acta) DOI: [10.1016/j.aca.2026.345215](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aca.2026.345215) *Highlights the role of advanced chromatographic techniques in evaluating mRNA-lipid nanoparticle quality.*
2. **Targeted Lipid Nanoparticle Delivery of FAP-CAR mRNA Enables Potent In Vivo T-Cell Engineering Against Pancreatic Tumors** (Cancer Immunology Research) DOI: [10.1158/2326-6066.cir-25-0663](https://doi.org/10.1158/2326-6066.cir-25-0663) *Demonstrates the potential for targeted lipid nanoparticles to enhance T-cell therapy efficacy in cancer treatment.*
3. **Lipid-Based Ionic Liquids Enable Efficient mRNA Intracellular Delivery** (Chemistry Letters) DOI: [10.1093/chemle/upag025](https://doi.org/10.1093/chemle/upag025) *Explores the use of lipid-based ionic liquids to improve mRNA delivery into cells.*
4. **A new type of lipid nanoparticles with sphingomyelin-induced active lipid raft structures for improved mRNA cellular uptake** (Journal of Controlled Release) DOI: [10.1016/j.jconrel.2026.114640](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jconrel.2026.114640) *Presents a novel lipid nanoparticle design that enhances mRNA uptake through lipid raft formation.*
5. **Protective effects of bee pollen and its solid lipid nanoparticle formulation against lead acetate-induced pulmonary toxicity in Wistar rats** (Proceedings of the Indian National Science Academy) DOI: [10.1007/s43538-026-00703-3](https://doi.org/10.1007/s43538-026-00703-3) *Investigates bee pollen nanoparticles as a protective agent against pulmonary toxicity.*
6. **Toward In Vivo CAR T Cell Therapy: Perfecting CAR and Lipid Nanoparticle Design** (Nano Letters) DOI: [10.1021/acs.nanolett.5c05535](https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.nanolett.5c05535) *Focuses on optimizing CAR and lipid nanoparticle designs for enhanced CAR T cell therapy performance.*
